intro: Canscora pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in spring. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils, where it forms dense, low-growing mats. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
